etymologies: late 17th century: from Latin, literally ‘full space’, neuter of plenus ‘full’

definitions: an assembly of all the members of a group or committee

examples.text: the seventh plenum of the Communist Party central committee

shortDefinitions: assembly of all members of group or committee

definitions: a space completely filled with matter, or the whole of space so regarded

examples.text: so long as things move simultaneously into each other's places, motion is possible in a plenum

shortDefinitions: space completely filled with matter, or whole of space so regarded

definitions: an enclosed chamber where a treated substance collects for distribution, as heated or conditioned air through a ventilation system.
shortDefinitions: enclosed chamber where treated substance collects for distribution, as heated or conditioned air through ventilation system
